content: Investments Asked by AnonymousAsked on 22 Oct 2018In my school, I'm taught about how to use the variance, expected rate of return, beta coefficients, to determine if investing in the company is a good thing. Is this information usable out of school?1 answerAnswerBump0

Hariz Arthur Maloy, Independent Financial Advisor at Promiseland IndependentTop Contributor (Sep)Level 9. God of WisdomAnswered on 22 Oct 2018Absolutely. You'll most likely be investing yourself and risk indicators are important factors when deciding what and how much to invest in. 0 comments0
